Utility class to map a database cursor/resultset to a java bean

elton.kent

Method Detail

toBean

public static <T> T toBean(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                           java.lang.Class<T> type)
                throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                       java.lang.InstantiationException,
                       IntrospectionException,
                       java.sql.SQLException
Convert a ResultSet row into a JavaBean. This implementation uses reflection and BeanInfo classes to match column names to bean property names. Properties are matched to columns based on several factors:
  1. The class has a writable property with the same name as a column. The name comparison is case insensitive.
  2. The column type can be converted to the property's set method parameter type with a ResultSet.get* method. If the conversion fails (ie. the property was an int and the column was a Timestamp) an SQLException is thrown.

Primitive bean properties are set to their defaults when SQL NULL is returned from the ResultSet. Numeric fields are set to 0 and booleans are set to false. Object bean properties are set to null when SQL NULL is returned. This is the same behavior as the ResultSet get* methods.

To generate table from java beans use DatabaseBuilder class

Type Parameters:
T - The type of bean to create
Parameters:
rs - ResultSet that supplies the bean data
type - Class from which to create the bean instance
Returns:
the newly created bean
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs
java.lang.InstantiationException - If the constructor of type is not accessible
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the mentioned type is not accessible.
IntrospectionException

toBeanList

public static <T> java.util.List<T> toBeanList(Cursor cursor,
                                               java.lang.Class<T> type)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                           java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                           IntrospectionException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Populates a list of the specified bean type

The column names/types must be the same as the bean's field name and types.
It supports all the native types return by Cursor include blob (byte[]) Table

.
Column Name Column Type
Name String
Age Integer

Bean
//Bean class and setter methods has to be public. 
 public class Bean {
        private String name;
        private int age;
 
        public String getName() {
                return name;
        }
 
        public void setName(String name) {
                this.name = name;
        }
 
        public int getAge() {
                return age;
        }
 
        public void setAge(int age) {
                this.age = age;
        }
 
 }
Populating the Bean
 Cursor cursor=database.query(...);
 List=DBUtils.toBeanList(cursor,Bean.class);

To generate table from java beans use DatabaseBuilder class

type -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.InstantiationException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the class mentioned is not accessible
IntrospectionException - If there is trouble in getting the infromation from the class
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - If the setter methods in the bean are not public
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
